sentences: Ta avas akna tuule käe külge.
Lõpetame töö ja avad sa meile uue veini?
context: The Estonian word 'avada' is the infinitive form of the verb meaning 'to open'. It's used when talking about opening doors, windows, containers, starting something new, or initiating an action. The conjugated forms include 'avan' (I open), 'avad' (you open), etc.
